title: What font is this?
content:
I would like to know what font this is.  
Thanks in advance!

Andreas

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tui.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621225103/http:/typophile.com/files/tui_0.JPG) | 26.13 KB |
author: andersom

comments.content: TUI uses a proprietary font, done by [DaltonMaag](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621225103/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/about/commissioning/case_studies/index.html). Don’t know if that’s the one you are looking for, because DM don’t show a sample of this exclusive font.

It is. 'TUI Type', by/from Dalton Maag.  
 [daltonmaag.com/browse/custom/clients/tui](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621225103/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/custom/clients/tui)  
 [typografie.info/typowiki/index.php?title=Hausschrift-Liste\_Unternehmen-zu-Schrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621225103/http:/www.typografie.info/typowiki/index.php?title=Hausschrift-Liste_Unternehmen-zu-Schrift)

Dav
Oh, yes. Thanks, Dav, for confirming. Greetings from Linz to Linz. ;^D

Thanks for the help!  
nice sources

As alternatives, you might like DM's [Tondo](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621225103/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/dalton_maag/tondo/) or [FF Nuvo](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621225103/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Nuvo%20OT).

It also reminds me of [ITC Adderville](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621225103/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_adderville_std_vp/), though that's certainly more casual, and [Cronos](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621225103/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/cronos_pro_ot_virtual/).
